p: Recognition of adaptation as a GPG will require additional money. The $100 billion pledge by 2020 is far below the need. Addressing borderless risks is likely to divert more climate finance or ODA from national-level actions. Kaul et al., 2003, Kaul, 2017c) argue that GPG financing must not jeopardize ODA since it is needed for basic provisions in poor countries, while the supply of GPGs can contribute to resilience to climate impacts and poverty reduction (Kaul 2013). So the Paris Agreement (Article 9.3) provides that “developed country Parties should take the lead in mobilizing climate finance from a variety of sources, instruments, and channels, noting the significant role of public funds …”
